DOC.brief_summary: Sixty patients were randomized to receive either placebo or diazepam in addition to mechanical physiotherapy and analgesics for the first 7 days of conservative treatment of clinically and radiologically confirmed lumbar disk prolapse
DOC.brief_title: Do Benzodiazepines Improve the Outcome of Mechanical Physiotherapy for Lumbar Disk Prolapse
DOC.criteria: sciatica without or with neurological deficit attributable to lumbar disc prolapse CT or MRI confirmation of lumbar disc prolapse informed consent bladder or bowel disturbance acute (< 24 h) development of paresis grade 1 or plegia taken benzodiazepines for more than 2 weeks history of benzodiazepine intolerance prior surgery for disc prolapse, or prior trauma to the vertrebral column
